meanings.definition: To throw farther or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outthrew her friend in the discus throw competition.
meanings.sent2: He outthrew all his competitors in the javelin event.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outthrew the boys in the baseball game, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His determination outthrew any doubts that he couldn't succeed.
meanings.sent5: The coach's training helped her outthrew her personal best.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she outthrew her previous record in shot put.
meanings.sent2: He outthrew his opponent in the final round of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat outthrew the dog in the race to the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outthrew the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm outthrew all our plans for a picnic.
